intro: Hysterobaeckea occlusa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hakea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and persistent foliage. The plant produces cylindrical, woody fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. Hysterobaeckea occlusa is often found in heathlands and is an important component of local ecosystems.
